clusters.title: How the FBI uncovered new footage from Nancy Guthrie's home
clusters.neutral_headline: FBI releases images of masked person in hunt for Savannah Guthrie's mother
bullet_summary: Reported by CBS News, BBC World, Reuters Top News and others

items.title: How the FBI uncovered new footage from Nancy Guthrie's home
items.standfirst: The FBI on Tuesday released surveillance footage connected to the disappearance of Nancy Guthrie, the mother of "Today" show co-host Savannah Guthrie. The photos and videos show a masked, armed individual outside Nancy's home. CBS News' Andres Gutierrez, Anna Schecter and Weijia Jiang have more.
items.content: The FBI on Tuesday released surveillance footage connected to the disappearance of Nancy Guthrie, the mother of "Today" show co-host Savannah Guthrie. The photos and videos show a masked, armed individual outside Nancy's home. CBS News' Andres Gutierrez, Anna Schecter and Weijia Jiang have more.

items.title: FBI releases images of masked person in hunt for Savannah Guthrie's mother
items.standfirst: The mother of the news anchor Savannah disappeared in the middle of night from her Tucson, Arizona, home and was last seen on 31 January.
items.content: The mother of the news anchor Savannah disappeared in the middle of night from her Tucson, Arizona, home and was last seen on 31 January.

items.standfirst: Authorities on Tuesday released new surveillance images of a subject sought in the disappearance of Nancy Guthrie. Mary Ellen O'Toole, former senior FBI profiler, joins CBS News to discuss what stands out.
items.content: Authorities on Tuesday released new surveillance images of a subject sought in the disappearance of Nancy Guthrie. Mary Ellen O'Toole, former senior FBI profiler, joins CBS News to discuss what stands out.

items.title: FBI releases images of masked suspect in kidnapping of TV anchor Guthrie's mother
items.standfirst: On Tuesday, the FBI released images of a masked individual, described as “armed”, who appeared to be tampering with the front-door camera at the home of the mother of NBC presenter Savannah Guthrie. Nancy Guthrie, now missing for ten days, is believed to have been abducted from her home in Tucson, Arizona in a case that has gripped the US.
items.content: On Tuesday, the FBI released images of a masked individual, described as “armed”, who appeared to be tampering with the front-door camera at the home of the mother of NBC presenter Savannah Guthrie. Nancy Guthrie, now missing for ten days, is believed to have been abducted from her home in Tucson, Arizona in a case that has gripped the US.

items.title: Trump to repeal EPA finding that greenhouse gases threaten public health
items.standfirst: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration is preparing to rescind an Obama-era scientific finding that has served as the legal underpinning for federal regulations targeting greenhouse gases for more than a decade. In a major blow to federal efforts to combat climate change, the Environmental…

The EPA, under Lee Zeldin, plans to revoke the 2009 "endangerment finding", an Obama-era…
items.content: "Largest Act Of Deregulation In US History": Trump Admin To Repeal Obama-Era Greenhouse Gas Finding The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency is about to pull the rug from underneath climate regulation... The EPA, under Lee Zeldin, plans to revoke the 2009 "endangerment finding", an Obama-era…

items.title: Trump to repeal key ruling allowing regulation of planet-heating gases
items.standfirst: Climate groups vow to fight rollback of 2009 finding determining CO2 and other greenhouse gases harm healthIn what is set to be its most audacious anti-environment move yet, the Trump administration on Thursday will roll back the mechanism allowing the government to regulate planet-heating pollution, the White House press secretary has told reporters.“President Trump will be joined by EPA Administrator Lee Zeldin to formalize the recession of the 2009 Obama-era endangerment finding,” Karoline Leavitt said at a press conference on Tuesday. “This will be the largest deregulatory action in American history.” Continue reading...
items.content: Climate groups vow to fight rollback of 2009 finding determining CO2 and other greenhouse gases harm healthIn what is set to be its most audacious anti-environment move yet, the Trump administration on Thursday will roll back the mechanism allowing the government to regulate planet-heating pollution, the White House press secretary has told reporters.“President Trump will be joined by EPA Administrator Lee Zeldin to formalize the recession of the 2009 Obama-era endangerment finding,” Karoline Leavitt said at a press conference on Tuesday. “This will be the largest deregulatory action in American history.” Continue reading...

items.title: Trump administration to repeal legal cornerstone of US climate regulations
items.standfirst: The Trump administration is set to repeal an Obama-era regulation that serves as the basis for combating greenhouse gas emissions in the US, White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt announced on Tuesday.
items.content: The Trump administration is set to repeal an Obama-era regulation that serves as the basis for combating greenhouse gas emissions in the US, White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt announced on Tuesday.

clusters.title: Iran tells US not to let Netanyahu thwart nuclear talks before Trump meeting
clusters.neutral_headline: Iran tells US not to let Netanyahu thwart nuclear talks before Trump meeting
bullet_summary: Reported by Guardian World, Al Jazeera, France24

items.title: Iran tells US not to let Netanyahu thwart nuclear talks before Trump meeting
items.standfirst: Tehran’s intervention comes as the Israeli prime minister heads to a hastily arranged White House encounterTehran has told the US not to allow Israel to destroy the chance of reaching an agreement over Iran’s nuclear programme amid speculation that Benjamin Netanyahu intends to use a hastily arranged White House meeting with Donald Trump on Wednesday to divert negotiations.Iran’s intervention came as the Israeli prime minister flew to Washington to plead with Trump not to negotiate a deal with Tehran if it excludes limiting the country’s ballistic missile programme, dropping its support for proxy forces in the region and curtailing human rights abuses at home. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

clusters.title: Hong Kong’s once-vibrant press stays silent or celebrates Jimmy Lai’s 20-year jail sentence
clusters.neutral_headline: Jimmy Lai: Hong Kong media tycoon gets 20 years in jail – The Latest
bullet_summary: Reported by Guardian World, Sky News World, BBC World

items.title: Hong Kong’s once-vibrant press stays silent or celebrates Jimmy Lai’s 20-year jail sentence
items.standfirst: Lack of response shows security law and harassment by authorities have muzzled ‘critical voices’, say expertsThe rise and fall of Jimmy Lai, whose trajectory mirrored that of Hong Kong itselfHong Kong’s once-vibrant media outlets have responded with silence or celebration to the 20-year jail sentence handed down to Jimmy Lai, a pro-democracy media tycoon and critic of the Chinese Communist party.Lai, 78, was sentenced on Monday to 20 years in prison after being convicted of sedition and colluding with foreign forces under Hong Kong’s national security law. The charges were widely seen as being politically motivated and designed to silence one of Hong Kong’s most influential pro-democracy campaigners. Continue reading...
items.content: Lack of response shows security law and harassment by authorities have muzzled ‘critical voices’, say expertsThe rise and fall of Jimmy Lai, whose trajectory mirrored that of Hong Kong itselfHong Kong’s once-vibrant media outlets have responded with silence or celebration to the 20-year jail sentence handed down to Jimmy Lai, a pro-democracy media tycoon and critic of the Chinese Communist party.Lai, 78, was sentenced on Monday to 20 years in prison after being convicted of sedition and colluding with foreign forces under Hong Kong’s national security law. The charges were widely seen as being politically motivated and designed to silence one of Hong Kong’s most influential pro-democracy campaigners. Continue reading...

items.title: Hong Kong leader celebrates Jimmy Lai's sentence - as plan to enhance security law published
items.standfirst: The leader of Hong Kong has celebrated the 20-year jail sentence given to British pro-democracy campaigner Jimmy Lai, saying the media tycoon had "poisoned" the city.
items.content: The leader of Hong Kong has celebrated the 20-year jail sentence given to British pro-democracy campaigner Jimmy Lai, saying the media tycoon had "poisoned" the city.

items.title: Jimmy Lai: Hong Kong media tycoon gets 20 years in jail – The Latest
items.standfirst: The media mogul and prominent pro-democracy activist Jimmy Lai has been sentenced to 20 years in prison in Hong Kong for national security offences. His family has described the sentence as ‘heartbreakingly cruel’, given the 78-year-old’s declining health. Lai was convicted in December on charges of sedition and conspiracy to collude with foreign forces, after pleading not guilty to all charges. Lucy Hough speaks to the Guardian’s senior China correspondent, Amy Hawkins – watch on YouTube Continue reading...
items.content: The media mogul and prominent pro-democracy activist Jimmy Lai has been sentenced to 20 years in prison in Hong Kong for national security offences. His family has described the sentence as ‘heartbreakingly cruel’, given the 78-year-old’s declining health. Lai was convicted in December on charges of sedition and conspiracy to collude with foreign forces, after pleading not guilty to all charges. Lucy Hough speaks to the Guardian’s senior China correspondent, Amy Hawkins – watch on YouTube Continue reading...

items.standfirst: The pro-democracy media tycoon was sentenced to 20 years in jail by the Hong Kong High Court.
items.content: The pro-democracy media tycoon was sentenced to 20 years in jail by the Hong Kong High Court.

items.title: Counter-terrorism unit leads inquiry into stabbing of two boys at north London school
items.standfirst: Boy, 13, held on suspicion of attempted murder after pupils aged 12 and 13 stabbed at Kingsbury high schoolA police counter-terrorism unit was on Tuesday night leading the inquiry into the stabbing of two boys aged 13 and 12 at a school in north-west London.Police were called to Kingsbury high school in Brent on Tuesday afternoon after reports that a 13-year-old boy had been stabbed. When they arrived at the scene, officers found a 12-year-old boy who had also been stabbed. Continue reading...

items.title: Former senior aide to Starmer loses whip over friendship with sex offender
items.standfirst: Labour peer Matthew Doyle has apologised for links to Sean Morton who was convicted of possession of indecent images of childrenKeir Starmer’s longstanding communications chief has been suspended from the Labour whip in his new role in the Lords after it emerged that he had campaigned on behalf of a friend who had been charged with possessing indecent images of children.Matthew Doyle, who stepped down as the No 10 head of communications last March and was made a peer in December, said in a statement that he apologised for his links to Sean Morton, a former Labour councillor in Scotland who was convicted in 2018 of possessing the images. Continue reading...
items.content: Labour peer Matthew Doyle has apologised for links to Sean Morton who was convicted of possession of indecent images of childrenKeir Starmer’s longstanding communications chief has been suspended from the Labour whip in his new role in the Lords after it emerged that he had campaigned on behalf of a friend who had been charged with possessing indecent images of children.Matthew Doyle, who stepped down as the No 10 head of communications last March and was made a peer in December, said in a statement that he apologised for his links to Sean Morton, a former Labour councillor in Scotland who was convicted in 2018 of possessing the images. Reported by Reuters Top News, Guardian World

items.title: Tuesday’s Mini-Report, 2.10.26
items.standfirst: Today’s edition of quick hits. * The 38th strike: “A U.S. military boat strike, the third this year, blew up a vessel suspected of carrying drugs in the eastern Pacific Ocean on Monday, killing two people and leaving a lone survivor, the Pentagon’s Southern Command said. Southern Command, or…
items.content: Today’s edition of quick hits. * The 38th strike: “A U.S. military boat strike, the third this year, blew up a vessel suspected of carrying drugs in the eastern Pacific Ocean on Monday, killing two people and leaving a lone survivor, the Pentagon’s Southern Command said. Southern Command, or…

items.title: US says two people killed in military strike on boat in Pacific
items.standfirst: Officials say rescuers searching for lone survivor after latest attack on what Pentagon says are suspected drug smugglersThe US military’s Southern Command, which oversee operations in Latin America and the Caribbean, announced that it carried out another deadly strike on Monday, killing two suspected drug smugglers in the eastern Pacific.The statement said that the latest in what legal experts have called a series of extrajudicial killings by the Pentagon was carried out “at the direction of” the Florida-based combat unit’s new commander, Gen Francis L Donovan, who was sworn in at a Pentagon ceremony last Thursday. Donovan takes over after a US navy admiral, Alvin Holsey, chose to retire over reported disagreements over the boat-strike policy. Continue reading...
items.content: Officials say rescuers searching for lone survivor after latest attack on what Pentagon says are suspected drug smugglersThe US military’s Southern Command, which oversee operations in Latin America and the Caribbean, announced that it carried out another deadly strike on Monday, killing two suspected drug smugglers in the eastern Pacific.The statement said that the latest in what legal experts have called a series of extrajudicial killings by the Pentagon was carried out “at the direction of” the Florida-based combat unit’s new commander, Gen Francis L Donovan, who was sworn in at a Pentagon ceremony last Thursday. Donovan takes over after a US navy admiral, Alvin Holsey, chose to retire over reported disagreements over the boat-strike policy. Continue reading...

items.title: US judges dismiss lawsuits accusing fantasy author Neil Gaiman of sexual assault in New Zealand
US judges dismiss lawsuits accusing Neil Gaiman of sexual assault
items.standfirst: Former nanny Scarlett Pavlovich filed suit in three US states alleging author assaulted her in New Zealand in 2022Federal judges have dismissed three lawsuits accusing the bestselling fantasy author Neil Gaiman of sexually assaulting his children’s nanny in New Zealand four years ago.Scarlett Pavlovich filed a lawsuit against Gaiman and his wife, Amanda Palmer, in Wisconsin in February 2025, accusing Gaiman of multiple sexual assaults while she worked as the family’s nanny in 2022. She filed lawsuits against Palmer in Massachusetts and in New York on the same day she filed the Wisconsin action. Continue reading...
items.content: Former nanny Scarlett Pavlovich filed suit in three US states alleging author assaulted her in New Zealand in 2022Federal judges have dismissed three lawsuits accusing the bestselling fantasy author Neil Gaiman of sexually assaulting his children’s nanny in New Zealand four years ago.Scarlett Pavlovich filed a lawsuit against Gaiman and his wife, Amanda Palmer, in Wisconsin in February 2025, accusing Gaiman of multiple sexual assaults while she worked as the family’s nanny in 2022. She filed lawsuits against Palmer in Massachusetts and in New York on the same day she filed the Wisconsin action. Continue reading...

items.title: Democrats introduce 'Virginia's Law' alongside Epstein victims
items.standfirst: Congressional ​Democrats introduced legislation on Tuesday that they said would eliminate the statute of limitations that has shielded sex ⁠traffickers such as the late financier Jeffrey Epstein. The proposal — Virginia's Law — is named after Giuffre, ​one of Epstein's most prominent accusers, who died by suicide last year. FRANCE 24's Monte Francis reports
items.content: Congressional ​Democrats introduced legislation on Tuesday that they said would eliminate the statute of limitations that has shielded sex ⁠traffickers such as the late financier Jeffrey Epstein. The proposal — Virginia's Law — is named after Giuffre, ​one of Epstein's most prominent accusers, who died by suicide last year. FRANCE 24's Monte Francis reports

items.title: Democrats introduce 'Virginia's law' named for Epstein accuser to end shield for sex traffickers
items.standfirst: Victims of convicted sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein and Congressional Democrats introduced a new bill on Tuesday which would eliminate the statute of limitations for adult victims and would broaden victims' legal recourse.
items.content: Victims of convicted sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein and Congressional Democrats introduced a new bill on Tuesday which would eliminate the statute of limitations for adult victims and would broaden victims' legal recourse.

items.title: REPLAY: Epstein survivors and lawmakers introduce 'Virginia's Law'
items.standfirst: Democrats and survivors of sex offender Jeffrey Epstein introduced a bill at a press conference Tuesday to introduce a "Virginia's Law", named after Epstein victim Virginia Giuffre. The legislation would end statute of limitation barriers to filing a lawsuit. Watch the press conference in full above.
items.content: Democrats and survivors of sex offender Jeffrey Epstein introduced a bill at a press conference Tuesday to introduce a "Virginia's Law", named after Epstein victim Virginia Giuffre. The legislation would end statute of limitation barriers to filing a lawsuit. Watch the press conference in full above.

clusters.title: Plane ends up in ocean after emergency landing and all 55 people on board survive
clusters.neutral_headline: Pilot praised after crash-landing faulty Somali passenger plane on seashore
bullet_summary: Reported by Sky News World, BBC World

items.title: Plane ends up in ocean after emergency landing and all 55 people on board survive
items.standfirst: All 55 people on board a passenger plane were safely evacuated after the aircraft overran the runway and ended up in shallow waters during an emergency landing in Somalia.
items.content: All 55 people on board a passenger plane were safely evacuated after the aircraft overran the runway and ended up in shallow waters during an emergency landing in Somalia.

items.title: Pilot praised after crash-landing faulty Somali passenger plane on seashore
items.standfirst: All 55 people on board survived after the plane failed to land on the runway near the shoreline.
items.content: All 55 people on board survived after the plane failed to land on the runway near the shoreline.

clusters.title: Paramount expands offer for Warner Bros amid hostile takeover bid
clusters.neutral_headline: Paramount expands offer for Warner Bros amid hostile takeover bid
bullet_summary: Reported by Al Jazeera, Financial Times

items.title: Paramount expands offer for Warner Bros amid hostile takeover bid
items.standfirst: The Ellison-backed US media giant offered a so-called ticking fee for each month the deal fails to close.
items.content: The Ellison-backed US media giant offered a so-called ticking fee for each month the deal fails to close.

items.title: Paramount sweetens takeover offer for Warner Bros Discovery
items.standfirst: Media group adds ‘ticking fee’ to give shareholders additional payment for every quarter deal does not close
items.content: Media group adds ‘ticking fee’ to give shareholders additional payment for every quarter deal does not close

clusters.title: Tearful Olympian admits to cheating on girlfriend after medal win
clusters.neutral_headline: Laegreid wins bronze then confesses to affair on TV
bullet_summary: Reported by Sky News World, BBC World

items.title: Tearful Olympian admits to cheating on girlfriend after medal win
items.standfirst: Norwegian Olympian Sturla Holm Laegreid confessed in a live television interview to cheating on his girlfriend, moments after winning a bronze medal.
items.content: Norwegian Olympian Sturla Holm Laegreid confessed in a live television interview to cheating on his girlfriend, moments after winning a bronze medal.

items.title: Laegreid wins bronze then confesses to affair on TV
items.standfirst: Winter Olympics bronze medallist Sturla Holm Laegreid says on live TV that he made the "biggest mistake" by cheating on his girlfriend.
items.content: Winter Olympics bronze medallist Sturla Holm Laegreid says on live TV that he made the "biggest mistake" by cheating on his girlfriend.

clusters.title: YouTube Lawyer Sees No Addiction From Half Hour of Videos a Day
clusters.neutral_headline: Instagram and YouTube owners built 'addiction machines', trial hears
bullet_summary: Reported by Bloomberg Technology, BBC World

items.title: YouTube Lawyer Sees No Addiction From Half Hour of Videos a Day
items.standfirst: The 20-year-old woman at the center of a landmark trial over social media addiction used YouTube for an average of just 29 minutes per day over the last five years, a lawyer for Google told jurors.
items.content: The 20-year-old woman at the center of a landmark trial over social media addiction used YouTube for an average of just 29 minutes per day over the last five years, a lawyer for Google told jurors.

items.title: Instagram and YouTube owners built 'addiction machines', trial hears
items.standfirst: The tech giants are under scrutiny over social media addiction in a landmark jury trial in Los Angeles
items.content: The tech giants are under scrutiny over social media addiction in a landmark jury trial in Los Angeles
